author: shenron
title: A bit too simple
review:
One of the very earliest boats to use one-piece sections, this police has three of them. The overall look is not bad at all, but the building is really quite simple and takes too short time to complete (probably has less than 40 pieces). Furthermore, the minifigures do not fit inside because the roof is too low. There is serious room for improvement.

The boat section pieces always lower the building value of boat sets, and increase the price per piece, but don't look bad. The set comes with a special weight piece that can be attached below to allow the boat to float in water quite well.

The set has a few rare pieces that aren't found in post-'70s sets: the 2x1 clear-transparent slopes and the two technic pieces that make the antenna.

author: Kruu
title: My first boat
review:
This was my favorita bathtub toy, loved this when I was a kid, stil have it, my son plays with it in the tub now, minifigs are old scholl style, only mine had black antena

The set it self is realy simple only a cople of dozen peaces

author: Freezdried
title: Add one point for nostalgia
review: I remember owning this set when I was a kid.  I'm sure my parents still have some of the pieces in their basement, but the boat itself is long gone.  The best thing about this set - it floats!  Worst thing about this set - it doesn't stand up to modern Lego creations, not by a long shot.  Still, it was a great toy for kids in the '70's.

author: PetskuBricksterYT
title: cool little classic set
review: This set is not the most beautiful police boat that lego has made, however, it is still great, there is no playability really, but the build makes me like it enough. Alright amount of pieces, build is very easy, but it is still good build, love to have it in my shelf, and it is so great little classic.
